free_text.Form of examination: Throughout semester[br/]30% homeworks + 60% exams + 10% course activity[br/]
free_text.Bibliography and material: Code Complete: A Practical Handbook of Software Construction [br/](2nd edition) by Steve McConnell, Microsoft Press, 2004 [br/](ISBN 0735619670)
free_text.Required prior knowledge: (CS-205) Advanced topics in programming, (CS-206) Concurrency, (CS-207) System oriented programming
free_text.Content: Object-oriented design and reasoning[br/]Design patterns[br/]Building reliable software[br/]Performance tuning[br/]Testing and debugging[br/]Code layout and style[br/]Development processes
free_text.Learning outcomes: This course provides the foundations of becoming a good software engineer: how to think about software, how to structure software, how to modify it, and how to evaluate it.[br/]Students are encouraged to take in parallel CS-306 (Software Development Project).

en.title: Software engineering
en.library_recommends:
• "Clean code : a handbook of agile software craftsmanship / Robert C. Martin ; [with] Michael C. Feathers ... [et al.]". Year:2008. ISBN:978-0-13-235088-4
  • "Code complete : [a practical handbook of software construction] / Steve McConnell". Year:2004. ISBN:0-7356-1967-0
  • "The deadline : a novel about project management / Tom DeMarco". Year:1987. ISBN:0-932633-39-0
